snippet: The device in your purse or jeans that you think is a cellphone — guess again. It is a tracking device that happens to make calls.
abstract: News analysis; the principal function of smartphones is not to make calls, but to track their owner's behavior, according to numerous studies; even more diabolical is that they can predict an owner's future whereabouts with a high degree of accuracy; all this raises the question of whether calling the devices phones is helpful.

byline.original: By PETER MAASS and MEGHA RAJAGOPALAN

lead_paragraph: The device in your purse or jeans that you think is a cellphone — guess again. It is a tracking device that happens to make calls.

headline.seo: That’s Not My Phone, It’s My Tracker
headline.main: That’s No Phone. That’s My Tracker.
headline.print_headline: That’s No Phone. That’s My Tracker.
